result.execSummary:
The defendant Howard R Scott was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  
*  Pay supervision fees.  
Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.  
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.  
*  DE is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.  
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Parker.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 12 months w/conditions, consecutive to 07CF60 and concurrent to 15CF507; deft to pay $250 DNA surcharge.
Sentencing on 10/15/15 at 2:30 changed to 10/14/15 at 2:00 on the Court's own motion.  Atty Parker and ADA Jennifer Phan notified by email.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney L Parker.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft pleads guilty.  Court finds deft guilty.  PSI ordered.  DNA sample ordered.  SEH 10/15/15 at 2:30pm.  Firearms warning given.  Bond continued.
filed by Atty Lara Parker
Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty L Parker appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft was not writted for hearing.  PLEAS set for 9/2/15 at 1:15pm.  Bond continued.
to consolidate cases for trial filed by ADA Phan
Atty Lara Parker

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Koesser.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Koesser moves to withdraw.  Court allows Atty Koesser to withdraw as counsel.  Deft makes speedy trial demand.  STC/joinder motion set for 8/11/15 at 8:30am, JS 10/12/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Atty H Koesser appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Koesser states they are waiting to see what deft is receiving for his revocation in another matter.  FPT continued to 7/22/15 at 8:15am.  Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney H Koesser.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Atty Koesser states the deft has a revocation pending; believes further negotiations are needed in this case.  FPT continued to 7/2/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Atty H Koesser appeared on behalf of deft.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Deft in custody but not brought over.  Atty Koesser states the deft has new charges pending.  FPT continued to 6/8/15 at 8:30am.  Bond continued.
Final pre-trial on May 28, 2015 at 08:45 am.

NO RECORD MADE.  Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  FPT continued to 5/28/15 at 8:45am.  Bond continued.

With Atty Koesser the FPT of 3/18/15 at 3pm is rescheduled, as the deft has a new job and will be working at that time, reset to 3/20/15 at 8:30am.  Atty Koesser notified deft by phone of the new date.
